properties.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast
properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 2 at 1:13PM PST until February 2 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 32 will
result in frost formation. For the Wind Advisory, northwest
winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. For the
first Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 26
possible. For the second Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures
as low as 28 possible.

* WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Central Coast and Santa Barbara
County Central Coast.

* WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, from 3 AM to 9 AM PST Monday.
For the Wind Advisory, until 10 PM PST this evening. For the
first Freeze Watch, from late Monday night through Tuesday
morning. For the second Freeze Watch, from late Tuesday night
through Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and
make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may
result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other
sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor
plumbing.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest winds late this afternoon into
evening, especially near the coast from Vandenberg to Point
Conception.
properties.instruction:
Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high
profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Plan for
extra time to defrost vehicle windshields.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 9 AM PST MONDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
